intro: Anomospermum froesii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and milky sap. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Anomospermum froesii is adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine.
